title: Request for Sterling PD's 2023-2024 Overtime Slips Request Data

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Request for Sterling PD's 2023-2024 Overtime Slips Request Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Every sworn officer and civilian member of the Sterling Policy Department for fiscal year 2023 and fiscal year 2024:

1. First and last name;
2. Unique sequence number;
4. 2023 - Requester's stated reason for overtime request
5. 2023 - If request was approved or denied
6. 2023 - Amount paid to officer and/or civilian in overtime 
7. 2024 - Requester's stated reason for overtime request
8. 2024 - If request was approved or denied
9. 2024 - Amount paid to officer and/or civilian in overtime

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Zeke Martin

title: Biden Documents

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Biden Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All letters, electronic or physical, from January 2017 to the present that were either sent to and received from Joseph R. Biden Jr. regarding documents and the Presidential Records Act (PRA). This can include all letters sent from NARA to his legal counsel that includes the following phrases: confidential documents, presidential records act, and 44 U.S.C. 2201-2209.
2. All communications between NARA and the following individuals/entities located in the White House: Ron Klain, President Biden, and Dana Remus. The communications from both electronic and physical format are to be from January 2021 to the present date, and contain the following phrases: confidential documents, presidential records act, and 44 U.S.C. 2201-2209.
3. All communications sent to and from the Department of Justice, including the office of the Attorney General, that contains the following phrases from January 2021 to the present date: Biden, confidential documents, presidential records act, and 44 U.S.C. 2201-2209.
4. All memorandums produced by either the office of general counsel at NARA, Debra Wall, and David S. Ferriero from January 2017 to the present date that pertains to the presidential records act as stated in 44 U.S.C. 2201-2209.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Gamez

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Indian Health Service)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Indian Health Service)
communications.communication:
Dear Indian Health Service,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to Indian Health Service's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

communications.subject: 25-028 FOIA Acknowledgement & Clarification
communications.communication:
Sia,
Good afternoon!
We received your FOIA request and attached is our acknowledgment letter which includes your FOIA case number, 25-028. I am the Government Information Specialist assigned to your FOIA case. Please refer to your FOIA case number when checking on the status of your request.
Also, to continue processing your request we would need clarification on the records you are searching for. Your request says, "chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent." Are you seeking emails from the Chief FOIA Officer's mailbox, Mr. Carl Mitchell? Or from the IHS FOIA Office group mailbox? Note: the group mailbox is the email account that receives FOIA requests and is the one to which your request was received.
Please respond back within 20 business days, or we will presume that you are no longer interested in this request and close your request.

Thank you for your interest in the Indian Health Service.
Respectfully,

David Meservey
Government Information Specialist/FOIA
Indian Health Service
5600 Fishers Lane
Rockville, MD 20857
IHSFOIAMailbox@ihs.gov<mailto:IHSFOIAMailbox@ihs.gov>

[cid:image001.png@01DB247B.2B70C630]

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #25-028
communications.communication:
Dear IHS,

Thank you for your email.

My name is Sai, not Sia.

> Are you seeking emails from the Chief FOIA Officer's mailbox, Mr. Carl Mitchell? Or from the IHS FOIA Office group mailbox?

I am seeking the former — emails from/to the Chief FOIA Officer. The clause "or equivalent" in my request modifies "inbox" / "spam folder" / "sent email folder", not "chief FOIA officer".

> Please respond back within 20 business days, or we will presume that you are no longer interested in this request and close your request.

There is no basis in law for you to "presume" that I am no longer interested in my request, or to close it for lack of response from me; case law clearly requires you to fulfill it with your best efforts.

Sincerely,
Sai

title: PDR_181

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: PDR_181
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All emails, text messages, chat messages (Teams, Slack, etc), and/or call logs regarding the fulfillment of PDR_181, including accompanying metadata. For any responsive chat and text messages, please provide messages sent/received in that thread within 1 hour of the responsive message as context.
2. Any notes, work logs, or other memoranda produced in the fulfillment of PDR_181.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: RE: Public Records Request 2024-05-12 08:16 PM(PST) Submission Notification - PDR_212 Terse
communications.communication:
Hi there,

Thank you for your public record request below for:
“MuckRock News, DEPT MR###### 263 Huntington Ave”


Please clarify what identifiable records you are requesting. State law requires the City to respond to requests for “identifiable public records” (RCW 42.56.080). An identifiable public record is one in which the requester has given "a reasonable description” enabling the government employee to locate the requested records. A date range may also help us identify records responsive to the request. If we do not receive clarification on what types of identifiable records you are requesting within thirty (30) days by Friday, June 14, we will close the request.


Your request has been assigned Public Records Request Number PDR_212 Terse

We are in the process of gathering, identifying, and reviewing records responsive to your request, and the records request is currently being processed by the Administrative Services department. It will take approximately 8-10 weeks to fulfill this request. Please know that this is only an estimate. Records can become available sooner or later than the estimated time given.

If you have any questions or concerns please feel free to contact me. I will be in contact with you shortly.



Thank you,

Megan Brehm
Deputy City Clerk

City of Burien
(206) 988-3578 Office
(206) 707-4894 City Cell
MeganB@burienwa.gov<mailto:MeganB@burienwa.gov>
Burienwa.gov
NOTICE OF PUBLIC DISCLOSURE: This e-mail account is public domain. Any correspondence from or to this e-mail account may be a public record. Accordingly, this e-mail, in whole or in part, may be subject to disclosure pursuant to RCW 42.56, regardless of any claim of confidentiality or privilege asserted by an external party.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #PDR_212
communications.communication:
Hello Megan,

In your previous message, you require that I clarify what “identifiable records” I am requesting within 30 days, citing RCW 42.56.080. My request specifically states "All emails, text messages, chat messages (Teams, Slack, etc), and/or call logs [...]" in item 1 and "Any notes, work logs, or other memoranda [...]" in item 2 specifically regarding public records request PDR_181. While 42.56.080 classifies "A request for all or substantially all records prepared, owned, used, or retained by an agency" as an invalid request, the statute continues "a request for all records regarding a particular topic or containing a particular keyword or name shall not be considered a request for all of an agency's records". The topic is clearly discernable from my original request: records "regarding the fulfillment of PDR_181".

Additionally, you ask for a "date range". It would be reasonable to assume that the date range would begin on the date the request was filed (April 14) until the date this request was received, rather than threatening to close my request if no clarification is provided. This is common practice by other municipal agencies I have requested similar records from.

As you are familiar with the Washington Public Records Act, it is hard not to wonder whether these are attempts to unreasonably delay my request or otherwise deny me access to the requested records. I again respectfully ask that I be provided with the full breadth of the requested information without unreasonable delay.

Thank you,
Rose

title: CMS Investigative File

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CMS Investigative File
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The complete investigative case file related to the deficiencies documented at Holston Valley Medical Center, Kingsport, Tennessee, on March 10, 2020, the survey completion date for EventID: O07B11. The investigation stems from complaint #50499 following the death of an unnamed patient who was admitted Nov. 9, 2019 after a motor vehicle crash and later died at the hospital (Facility ID: TNP531133) on Nov. 11, 2019. Please use the attached CMS-2567 form to aid in the production of the complete investigative file. 

This file may include but is not limited to: emails, written notes, video and audio recordings, copies of documents reviewed, transcripts of interviews and 911 calls, and settlements.  

I’m requesting expedited processing due to a “compelling need” for the public, particularly the residents of northeast Tennessee, to know about this hospital’s quality.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samantha Liss

communications.subject: FOIA-102620237074
communications.communication:
Good evening,
 This office is presently conducting a review of our pending Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests to ascertain if the requested information for the above referenced FOIA case is still desired. We apologize for the delay in responding to your request. However, because of the increasing number of requests received by the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS), we found it necessary to adopt the ruling in the case of Open America v. Watergate Special Prosecution Force, 547 F.2d 605 (D.C. Cir. 1976) and exercise due diligence by following a first-in, first-out FOIA processing.
 If you are still interested in receiving the documents, please respond to this email, and we will complete the processing of your request. If we have not received your response within 30 working days from the date of this email, we will assume you are no longer interested in receiving the documents and the case will be administratively closed. Thank you in advance for your time and consideration on this matter.


Jason Mastropaolo

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

I request all active contracts and/or intergovernmental service agreements with county sheriffs' offices for the housing, safekeeping and subsistence of federal detainees.

This request is being made for the purposes of newsgathering for MuckRock.com, not for any commercial interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public after being processed by a member of the news media.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Frank Matt

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Federal Labor Relations Authority)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Federal Labor Relations Authority)
communications.communication:
Dear Federal Labor Relations Authority,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to Federal Labor Relations Authority's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Tri-state form 1575s
communications.communication:
Mr. Mellins, thank you for your FOIA request recently submitted to the Office of the Secretary of Transportation (OST).  I don’t think we have anything to do with a “Form 1575”, but I see some indications that two other US DOT components might.

1. Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration (FMCSA)
https://ask.fmcsa.dot.gov/app/mcmiscatalog/mcmisform1575
Online report payment form for the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration (FMCSA).

2. Federal Highway Administration (FHWA)
https://www.fhwa.dot.gov/cfo/earmarkrepurposing/fhwa1575_example1_erp2023.pdf
FHWA Transfer Request: Earmark Repurposing

Does either one of them look like what you’re interested in?  If so, we can forward your request to the correct DOT component.  If you still believe this is a matter for OST, could you tell me a little more about the topic matter to help me track it down?

Thank you,
Dave Jones
OST FOIA

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Tri-state form 1575s

Sam Mellins

title: 07/24 RTK Whitehall Bureau of Police

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: 07/24 RTK Whitehall Bureau of Police
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

This Right-to-Know request is for the following documents regarding Whitehall Township Bureau of Police involvement in the rally, held on 4/13/2024, for former President Donald J. Trump at the Schnecksville Fire Company fairgrounds:

1. A roster of all employees of the department, including but not limited to first name, last name, badge number, salary, and date of hire.
2. All emails, text messages, call logs, and/or other communications among members of the department and between the department and other local, state, federal and campaign entities regarding the rally. Please provide communications that occurred any time between January 1, 2024 and the date of this request.
3. All invoices, memoranda of understanding or other such agreements showing and/or describing the services the department provided for the rally.
4. All overtime requests submitted to the department for hours worked on 4/13/2024.
5. Documents showing active shooter protocols for the department, including documents outlining any training department employees have taken in the past five years.

Please note, this request is not misdirected. I know the rally on 4/13/2024 occurred outside Whitehall Township police jurisdiction. However, photo and video from that day shows Whitehall Township police provided support.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Danielle Ohl

title: Sheriff data collection (2017-2022) (Stokes County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Sheriff data collection (2017-2022) (Stokes County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. the total number of use of force incidents from 2017-2022, separated by year. Please include as part of this a breakdown of how many use of force incidents in 2022 were related to law enforcement operations and how many were related to correctional/custodial operations. 
2. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by year and type of force, from 2017-2022 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2022, baton incidents in 2022, etc.)
3. the total number of civilian complaints against law enforcement that were reported and the total number sustained from 2017-2022, separated by year.  
4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained from 2017-2022, separated by year. 
5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained from 2017-2022, separated by year.  
6. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained from 2017-2022, separated by year. 
7. the total number of officer-involved shootings from 2017-2022, both fatal and non-fatal, separated by year.
8. the total number of people who the sheriff’s department used force against, broken down by race/ethnicity, in 2022.

When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data for each item in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead.  

Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints alleging police misconduct, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: A list of pending Title IX sexual violence investigations at post-secondary institutions in Nevada
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

This message is for Jessica Cabrera regarding the FOIA request reproduced below.

The Seattle OCR office has been processing this request, and I am hoping to connect with you to clarify your request.  Were you looking for a list of sexual violence cases filed against post-secondary institutions in Nevada since August 2020, a list of complaints still open, or something different?

Cases currently open for investigation can be found at OCR’s Open Investigations<https://ocrcas.ed.gov/open-investigations> webpage (https://ocrcas.ed.gov/open-investigations?field_ois_state=678&field_ois_discrimination_statute=701&field_ois_type_of_discrimination=727&items_per_page=20&field_ois_institution=&field_ois_institution_type=752&field_open_investigation_date_1=&field_open_investigation_date_2=&field_open_investigation_date=&field_open_investigation_date_3=), but this webpage does not provide historical data.

Please feel free to email me back or call me at the number below.  I am generally available between 8 am and 5 pm pacific time, but I can be available during other times upon request.

Thank you,

Margot Stevens

Attorney
Office for Civil Rights, Seattle Office

Seattle, WA 98174

title: City of Cortez Email Metadata 2007 to 2024 - 2

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request metadata relating to emails sent To, From, CC, or BCC the following accounts relating to emails from Jan. 1 2007 to present day sent To, From, CC, or BCC the following accounts:

zugallery.com - any from or to this domain
mcafeefarm.biz - any to or from this domain

"Rachael Marchbanks" Rachael Marchbanks <rmsimbeck@gmail.com>
Patricia Lacey <prflacey49@gmail.com>
Nancy Schaufele <nschaufele@gmail.com>
Jodi Jahrling <jodimy@gmail.com>
"Jodi Jahrling" <jodij@unitedway-swco.org>
Jodi Jahrling <jodi@wildbluebug.com>
4cornersbroads@gmail.com
Katrina Weiss <katrinashyamla@gmail.com>
Cheryl Lindquist <clindquist@cortezco.gov>

Please provide me the following information for all emails sent, received, or cc'd into the City's emails to/from/cc/bcc the above-listed accounts:

1. From address
2. To address
3. bcc addresses
4. cc addresses
5. Time
6. Date
7. Subject

Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. This is intended to lessen the burden as expressed by your city attorney. I am more than happy to provide documentation or tips for extracting this information from your mail server if needed. Google's Vault tooling should make this request straightforward to complete. E-mail metadata is trivially exportable from the IT infrastructure of any modern e-mail archiving or data retention system - such as Microsoft Outlook 365, Google, Datacove, etc. - and should be deliverable in a .CSV, .XLS, or other machine readable format. 

Please save yourself the step of transforming the CSV into a PDF for submittal. It will save effort and ultimately save taxpayer funds if you just send me the .csv file.

Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. E-mail metadata does not include the contents of the specified e-mails, thus do not need individual review for redaction.


Please provide me the following information for all emails sent, received, or cc'd into the City's emails from Jan. 1 2007 to present day to/from/cc/bcc the above-listed accounts:

1. From address
2. To address
3. bcc addresses
4. cc addresses
5. Time
6. Date
7. Subject

Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. This is intended to lessen the burden as expressed by your city attorney. I am more than happy to provide documentation or tips for extracting this information from your mail server if needed. Google's Vault tooling should make this request straightforward to complete. E-mail metadata is trivially exportable from the IT infrastructure of any modern e-mail archiving or data retention system - such as Microsoft Outlook 365, Google, Datacove, etc. - and should be deliverable in a .CSV, .XLS, or other machine readable format. Please save yourself the step of transforming the CSV into a PDF for submittal. It will save effort and ultimately save taxpayer funds if you just send me the .csv file.

Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. E-mail metadata does not include the contents of the specified e-mails, thus do not need individual review for redaction.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. If possible, I would request a waiver of all fees for searching or copying these records in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding.

1. When filing this, please note which documents have already been paid for by another FOIA request, and I request that if those documents have already been screened, that they not be duplicated in cost.
2. When estimating cost of per page, please use the discretion allowed by the CORA statute to interpret the pages to be 11x17, multiple columns, and 4 point font. Since this is an electronic request, the print version should not be provided, but for purposes of cost estimation, please take into consideration that Cortez population is underprivileged, and extend the courtesy of pricing accordingly. Saving the step of transforming the CSV to PDF saves the City of Cortez time, saving the taxpayers of Cortez money. 
2a. The economic information for this judgment comes from the submission done by myself of Kauffman Indicators of Entrepreneurship for Montezuma County in comparison to many surrounding counties in Utah, New Mexico, and Colorado. As seen in page 8 of the publicly presented documents August 22, 2023, Montezuma County has compensation ranking at 39.27% within the Kaufmann Entrepreneurial Jobs Indicators, meaning that the policy taken by Cortez brings it into direct conflict with the interests of the people they impact should they price these or other electronic documents at a punitive rate.
2b. Because these documents are of the public interest, and the population is demonstrably disadvantaged, the policies of Cortez which require hundreds or thousands of dollars to achieve transparency could be construed poorly in civil proceedings, meaning that legal fees could ensue which would further penalize City of Cortez budgets. This is not my intent, therefore I state it up front that the best course of action would be to ensure that FOIA costs are not borne as specified.
3. Staff time to review these documents should reflect the actual costs, not the maximum costs allowed by CORA law, please recalculate these costs taking into consideration both the public interest as well as eliminating from your cost estimate any documents previously screened by staff.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely, 

Charles Jeter
---------

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Jeter

communications.subject: [Records Center] Police Department Records Request :: P003798-041824
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Hello Mr. Free, 
I've attached a copy of the DKPD Employee Manual which contains the information you are requesting in section:  3-4.2 Local Emergencies and the Georgia Mutual Aid Act. Thank You, David Rodriguez, Paralegal DeKalb County Police Department Open Records Unit

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request #P003798-041824
communications.communication:
Hi David, 

Thanks so much for your help with this request! I really appreciate it.

That said, I don’t think it’s what I requested. As I read it Section 3-4.2 of the manual describes the circumstances under which mutual aid can be requested / accepted, and the rules for doing so. 

But my request sought a record reflecting the process described in this manual actually happening: 

“A copy of any Memorandum of Understanding, Memorandum of Agreement, Mutual Aid Agreement, or other, similar document allowing the Atlanta Police Department to exercise police power outside the City of Atlanta's territorial jurisdiction in unincorporated Dekalb County.”

To narrow a bit, let’s focus on the property surrounding Key Road, Constitution, and Bouldercrest, where APD is currently exercising police power. Is there a memo of understanding for that exercise between DKPD and APD? If so, that’s what I thought I was requesting. Happy to file a new request and close this one out if it’s easier, but it also seems like a list of standing agreements reflecting the decisions laid out in 3-4.2 is a record DKPS would have that would be responsive to my original request. 

Thanks in advance! 


Sincerely,
Andrew Free

communications.subject: FOIA RESPONSE - FW: External: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA Request: Lobbying Reports
communications.communication:
Good Morning Muckrock,

Your below requests were mistakenly directed to our Illinois Secretary of State Police Department.  Please send all future FOIA requests to FOIARequest@ilsos.gov<mailto:FOIARequest@ilsos.gov>.


We acknowledge your below request pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. (FOIA) and it is already being processed.  Since your request requires consultation with other Departments and involves a search for voluminous records, we are taking the five working-day extension pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e).



As the request currently stands, we expect to provide you with responsive documents by October 24th with any necessary redactions.  Should the records be available sooner, we will send them to you then.



Respectfully,


[A close-up of a coin  Description automatically generated with medium confidence]
Danielle Pappas
Deputy General Counsel
Secretary of State Alexi Giannoulias
115 S. LaSalle St., Suite 300, Chicago IL 60603

communications.subject: RE: FOIA RESPONSE - FW: External: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA Request: Lobbying Reports
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

In follow up to your below request pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. (FOIA), please be advised that our Index Department has conducted a search and identified responsive records for four (4) out of the eight (8) entities listed in your request.  We will send those responsive documents under separate cover.

The Index Department conducted a search and was unable to locate any responsive records for:  “Genetec” “Rekor” “ZeroEyes” and “Skydio.”  Nor are there any records responsive to your request for “client annual reports,” because there is no document required or maintained by our Agency called a “client annual report.”  Rather, all registered lobbying entities are required to file expenditure reports twice a month.  Copies (.pdf) of all filed expenditure reports are available for free online through the Lobbyist Information Search on the ILSOS.gov website, located at:  Lobbyist Information Search (ilsos.gov)<https://www.ilsos.gov/departments/index/lobbyist/lobbyist_search.html>.  There are also .csv files available through the Illinois Data Portal:    Daily Lobbyist Data - Datasets - data.illinois.gov<https://data.illinois.gov/dataset/daily-lobbyist-data>.

We hope that this information is helpful to you.

Respectfully,

[A close-up of a coin  Description automatically generated with medium confidence]
FOIA OFFICER
Secretary of State Alexi Giannoulias
115 S. LaSalle St., Suite 300, Chicago IL 60603
foiarequest@ilsos.gov<mailto:foiarequest@ilsos.gov>

communications.subject: Iowa Open Records Law Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Iowa Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Specifically, I am requesting any and all records and materials related to the case of 
Suspect Name: Bravon Tukes
Description/Headline: Convicted shooter in Starts Right Here killings denies co-defendant helped plan attack
Link of the Article: https://eu.desmoinesregister.com/story/news/crime-and-courts/2023/10/11/starts-right-here-school-shooting-des-moines-trial-bravon-tukes-preston-walls/71142168007/
State: Lowa
Law Enforcement: Des Moines

included but not limited to the following:
Documents:
Incident reports
Investigation reports
Officer statements
Witness statements
Any other relevant case files

Footage:
Body camera footage from officers on the scene
Dash camera footage
Police surveillance camera footage
Private/public surveillance footage from nearby locations
Any footage collected as evidence or during the investigation

Audio:
911 calls
Police radio communications
Any other audio recordings related to the case
Visual Media:
Crime scene photographs
Surveillance stills
Photographs taken during the investigation

Court Records:
Transcripts from court hearings or proceedings
Any video/audio footage from court hearings
Court orders or any other court-related documents

Please include any and all materials, regardless of format (digital or physical), including those not listed above that are related to the case in question.
Additionally, if this request has been sent to the wrong department or agency, I would appreciate it if you could provide guidance or contact information for the correct department or agency that handles such requests.

If any part of the request is denied or redacted, please provide a detailed explanation of the specific legal exemption that applies.
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response within the period mandated by FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

david yupa

title: Health and mental healthcare and juvenile justice (Division Of Juvenile Corrections Wisconsin)

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Health and mental healthcare and juvenile justice (Division Of Juvenile Corrections Wisconsin)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern,

This is a request for records under your state public records law.  I am requesting copies of public records regarding health and behavioural health service delivery in youth correctional facilities in your jurisdiction, to inform a comparative research project regarding health and mental health care delivery in juvenile detention facilities across the US. Specifically, I request information regarding the following:
1. Name and contact details for those responsible for health and behavioural health services provisions at all locations where juveniles are incarcerated within your jurisdiction.
2. Regulations, policies and procedures that govern the operation of health and behavioral health provision for juveniles incarcerated within your jurisdiction. This includes health intake, room confinement, medication management,  access to specialist and dental services, discharge planning services, and other health and behavioral health related policies.
3. Contracts from January 1, 2021 to the time the request is filled between your agency and any healthcare provider including both physical health and behavioral health. 
4. Records concerning your jurisdiction’s most recent application to Centre for Medicaid Services (CMS) for an 1115 Medicaid waiver (if applicable), and any response, with specifically focus on how and whether such a waiver applies to provision of Medicaid funded services for detained juveniles.
5. Records relating to financing for health and behavioural health care delivery in your jurisdiction. 

I request the records be provided electronically. If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the administration of juvenile justice. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.

If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than allowed by statute, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies of the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Thank you for considering my request.

Sincerely,

Tess Kelly 
Fellow, Harvard FXB Centre for Health and Human Rights 

Joshua Dankoff
Director of Strategic Initiatives
Citizens for Juvenile Justice
617.338.1050

title: Request to NASA for list of 2023 film and TV collaborations

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to NASA for list of 2023 film and TV collaborations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all documentaries, feature films, and TV programs supported in any way by NASA in the year 2023. NASA has previously released such lists of media collaborations for other years, including to this requester, who has made them public.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

Rose Terse

08b Identifying Information of Juvenile RCW 13.50.100; RCW 42.56.070(1) Identifying information of a juvenile not related to the commission of a juvenile offense is confidential and exempt from disclosure. 

Please note there are black boxes (redactions) on various pages of the responsive documents. The black box may be small or large, depending on the size of the redaction. There may be multiple redactions on a page. Within the redaction is a white code, which will look something along the lines of “Redacted Text [1a].” This code designates the statutory exemption being applied to the document. If there is only one code on the page, but there are numerous redactions, that one statutory exemption applies to all the redactions. 
Provided with these responsive documents is a key to the codes. This key identifies the statutory bases for the exemption as well as a brief explanation for why the exemption applies. As you review these responsive documents, you will be able to refer to the key below to identify the exemption and its application. 
You should now be able to retrieve any responsive records via the Tukwila PD electronic Record Center. 
The records are best viewed on a desktop or laptop computer. The records may not be accessible from a mobile device. Review of the records for installments must be made within 30 days of notification of availability or the request can be closed. 
We estimate the next installment to this request will be available on or before 10/4/2024.  If public records become available in advance of this estimate we will contact you promptly.  Conversely, if the department encounters a need to extend our time estimate, we will contact you promptly with a revised estimated date. 
Regards, 
Rebecca

title: St. Mary's County Weekend Incarceration Fees

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: St. Mary's County Weekend Incarceration Fees
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Related to Maryland Code §11-801, which permits counties to impose fees on "weekend incarcerated individuals"; specifically 

1. The per diem rate, or daily charge, of the weekend incarceration fee imposed in the county detention/correctional facility both currently and in FY23.
2. The daily “average cost of providing food, lodging, and clothing for an incarcerated individual” in the county detention/correctional facility used to calculate the weekend incarceration fee in FY23.
3. The total number of individuals charged the weekend incarceration fee in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23. 
4. The total amount of fees collected from weekend incarcerated individuals in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23.
5. All policies and procedures regarding the imposition and collection of the weekend incarceration fee, including but not limited to guidelines on how these fees are determined and collected in the county detention/correctional facility.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wayne Byun

communications.subject: RE: Maryland Public Information Act Request: St. Mary's County Weekend Incarceration Fees
communications.communication:
Good morning Mr. Byun,

We have forwarded your Public Information Act Request to the St. Mary's County Detention and Rehabilitation Center (SMCDRC) as they are the custodian of the records that you are requesting.   Receipt of your Public information Request is acknowledged and it will be processed in accordance with GP 4-203(b)(2).

Best regards,


Karen M. Moore
St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office
Coordinator III
Office of Professional Responsibilities, Internal Affairs
Work: (301)475-4200 extension 1903
Karen.Moore@stmaryscountymd.gov<mailto:Karen.Moore@stmarysmd.com>
This electronic message transmission contains information that may be confidential or privileged.  The information is intended to be for the use of the individual or entity named above.  If you have received this communication in error, please re-send this communication to the sender and delete the original message and any copy of it from your computer system. Thank you.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Brea Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)
• TransUnion TLOxp, which may also be part of the TruLookup system (https://www.tlo.com/law-enforcement)
• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

For each of the above mentioned platforms, please provide the following records: 

• CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS —  All contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits) and agreements related to the acquisition and use of these "software" programs.
• PURCHASE INFORMATION — All invoices and purchase information for costs and products associated with the above-referenced platforms.

Please provide responsive materials for the period from January 1, 2021 through the date this request is processed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Katherine

title: Dorchester County Weekend Incarceration Fees

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Dorchester County Weekend Incarceration Fees
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Related to Maryland Code §11-801, which permits counties to impose fees on "weekend incarcerated individuals"; specifically:  

1. The per diem rate, or daily charge, of the weekend incarceration fee imposed in the county detention/correctional facility both currently and in FY23.
2. The daily “average cost of providing food, lodging, and clothing for an incarcerated individual” in the county detention/correctional facility used to calculate the weekend incarceration fee in FY23.
3. The total number of individuals charged the weekend incarceration fee in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23. 
4. The total amount of fees collected from weekend incarcerated individuals in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23.
5. All policies and procedures regarding the imposition and collection of the weekend incarceration fee, including but not limited to guidelines on how these fees are determined and collected in the county detention/correctional facility.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly Stevenson

title: Excited Delirium/Acute Behavior Disorder

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Excited Delirium/Acute Behavior Disorder
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All current training materials which mention or describe how to handle "acute behavior disorder", "acute behavioral disturbance", "excited delirium" or "agitated delirium"
- All communications and documentation discussing changes to police manual 16.135

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: Live Birth Data by School District - Source Data

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Live Birth Data by School District - Source Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

data and logic used in the calculation of the provisional numbers for 2021 in the spreadsheet provided in response to my previous FOIL request, FOIL #: 23-03-192.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All facial recognition technology policies and policy revisions submitted to the Kentucky Justice and Public Safety Cabinet since July 14, 2022 (as required by 61.9305). 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Rubin

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Administrative Conference of the United States)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Administrative Conference of the United States)
communications.communication:
Dear Administrative Conference of the United States,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to Administrative Conference of the United States's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #FOIA Case No. 20254
communications.communication:
Dear ACUS,

Thank you for your stellar response time on this request.

I note, however, that you disregarded my electronic form & format requests — and you additionally rasterized all of the records, and your response letter, which I specifically asked you not to do. OCR does not cure the destruction of the original structural metadata that makes it accessible, nor make available the parts of the records (such as hyperlinks, headers, etc) which were destroyed by rasterization. I did not consent to you making new, worse records in this way.

Please provide the emails in one of the native electronic email formats listed; any email software will save to them easily. They are generally in plain text or multipart MIME HTML format, which can be directly edited to make redactions if needed. You say that record #4 is a Web page; please provide it in original electronic format, such as HTM or MHTML. 

My form and format request is mandatory under 5 USC 552(a)(3)(B & C) & (f)(2)(A) (E-FOIA & FOIA Improvement Act) and 29 USC 794d (Rehab Act § 508).

Sincerely,
Sai

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #FOIA Case No. 20254
communications.communication:
Sai,

I am well aware of FOIA's requirements. FOIA does not impose an unbounded obligation to create requested information in a way that is usable or convenient for the requester. ACUS always attempts to provide records in the requested format, but that is not always possible. This reply is our best effort to provide you with the information without having to pay contractors to manipulate or present the information in your desired format.  There are no in-house IT personnel at our micro agency.

You will find attached two Outlook files-both sent to you yesterday in .pdf format. One file was modified to remove PII (after forwarding the document to myself so that it could be redacted). All links and such should be active. The redacted .pdf attachment to the redacted email was sent to you yesterday.

As for item 4, you specifically noted that ACUS could reply in a statement, which we did. ACUS has zero FTEs.  I attached the information about the FOIA.gov webpage as a convenience to you. If you have questions about that webpage, you should contact the Office of Information Policy at DOJ since they maintain the webpage.

Finally, you requested that the documents be uploaded to some sort of database for which you provided a link.  It is a security risk to click on links from unknown sources. In any event, FOIA does not require agencies to plug their responses into a requester's database.


Shawne C. McGibbon | General Counsel and Chief FOIA Officer (she/her)

[cid:image001.jpg@01DB255D.029DBDC0]
1120 20th Street, NW  Suite 706 South .  Washington, DC  .  20036
smcgibbon@acus.gov  .  www.acus.gov

title: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Oakland Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Oakland Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)
• TransUnion TLOxp, which may also be part of the TruLookup system (https://www.tlo.com/law-enforcement)
• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

For each of the above mentioned platforms, please provide the following records: 

• CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS —  All contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits) and agreements related to the acquisition and use of these "software" programs.
• PURCHASE INFORMATION — All invoices and purchase information for costs and products associated with the above-referenced platforms.

Please provide responsive materials for the period from January 1, 2021 through the date this request is processed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kyra Fields

title: Carroll County Weekend Incarceration Fees

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Carroll County Weekend Incarceration Fees
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Related to Maryland Code §11-801, which permits counties to impose fees on "weekend incarcerated individuals"; specifically: 

1. The per diem rate, or daily charge, of the weekend incarceration fee imposed in the county detention/correctional facility both currently and in FY23.
2. The daily “average cost of providing food, lodging, and clothing for an incarcerated individual” in the county detention/correctional facility used to calculate the weekend incarceration fee in FY23.
3. The total number of individuals charged the weekend incarceration fee in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23. 
4. The total amount of fees collected from weekend incarcerated individuals in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23.
5. All policies and procedures regarding the imposition and collection of the weekend incarceration fee, including but not limited to guidelines on how these fees are determined and collected in the county detention/correctional facility.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly Stevenson

communications.subject: Re: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Speed Enforcement Contract
communications.communication:
Dear Sir,
A request was to be submitted to the Purchasing Division via the PIA link
provided in an earlier email. I never received that request. In any event,
I have already requested permission from the contractor to release the
documents and am awaiting a response from them.

Your request includes copies of contractual documents. To the extent that
the County’s Purchasing Department has responsive documents, I will review
each document and determine if there is confidential commercial or
financial information from the vendor(s) that needs to be withheld or
redacted from production pursuant to MPIA §4-335. This includes certain
pricing data and information regarding a vendor’s equipment or processes. A
vendor would customarily not release such information to the public. I
would produce any responsive contractual documents with such confidential
commercial or financial information either withheld or redacted. With
regard to the time it is taking to make the records available to you, we
shall first notify the contractor of your request as a courtesy to them and
to allow them a reasonable amount of time to determine what they believe is
proprietary information in their proposal.

You may contact the Public Access Ombudsman per MPIA § 4-1B-04 regarding an
issue you have with this response. You may also challenge any part of this
response to your Request by filing an action in the appropriate court of
law pursuant to MPIA § 4-362. In addition, pursuant to MPIA § 4-1A-05, you
may file a complaint with the State Public Information Act Compliance
Board. I look forward to continuing to work with you on this Request.
Please do not hesitate to contact me at any time. Thank you.

Respectfully,

Diana G. Cox, CPM | Procurement Strategy Manager

Anne Arundel County Purchasing Division
p 410.222.7668  | c 240.927.2145 | e phcox001@aacounty.org | ms 9302

communications.subject: RE: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request #24-468
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Karlsson,

I hope this message finds you well, and that you are having a restful holiday weekend. My name is Matthew Petti and I am writing in regards to your OPRA response dated March 26, 2024. Thank you for your prompt response to my request.

However, I object to this denial. The Supreme Court’s decision in Gilleran relates to static security cameras, which are placed on a building and do not move. In contrast, a drone moves and is more on part with a policy body camera, dash camera, etc. There is no security issue in disclosing it.
 
Additionally, you cannot meet your burden by saying the video “may implicate privacy concerns.” A mere image of a juvenile or any other person in a public place does not warrant redaction, as there is no reasonable expectation of privacy in public. Similarly, “may also implicate matters relating to ongoing law enforcement investigations” is not an exemption.

I look forward to hearing to your response soon.

Best regards,
Matthew

communications.subject: RE: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request #24-468
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Karlsson,

I hope this message finds you well, and that you are having a restful holiday weekend. My name is Matthew Petti and I am writing in regards to your OPRA response dated March 26, 2024. Thank you for your prompt response to my request.

However, I object to this denial. The Supreme Court’s decision in Gilleran relates to static security cameras, which are placed on a building and do not move. In contrast, a drone moves and is more on part with a policy body camera, dash camera, etc. There is no security issue in disclosing it.

Additionally, you cannot meet your burden by saying the video “may implicate privacy concerns.” A mere image of a juvenile or any other person in a public place does not warrant redaction, as there is no reasonable expectation of privacy in public. Similarly, “may also implicate matters relating to ongoing law enforcement investigations” is not an exemption.

I look forward to hearing to your response soon.

Best regards,
Matthew

communications.subject: RE: [External]RE: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request #24-468
communications.communication:
Hello,



We write with respect to your April 5, 2024 reply to the City's March 14, 2024 response to your Open Public Records Act ("OPRA") request (ref. no. 24-468).  Your reply objects to the City's denial of access pursuant to OPRA's security exemption and based upon protecting the citizens' reasonable expectation of privacy who attended the Teaneck demonstration held on March 10, 2024.  The City evaluated its prior response in light of your reply, and its position remains that you are not legally entitled to access the requested materials.  In addition to the reasons set forth in the City's March 14, 2024 response, an additional reason that the requested materials are exempt from public access is that the underlying footage constitutes law enforcement records relating to citizens who were neither arrested nor charged.  See Fuster v. Twp. of Chatham, 477 N.J. Super. 477 (App. Div. 2023) (determining that government records involving a person who has not been arrested or charged with an offense are entitled to confidentiality based upon long-established judicial precedent).  As such, the City is legally precluded from releasing any footage of citizens generated during the March 10th demonstration.  We trust that this correspondence satisfies your concerns, and we again note that the City is closing out your OPRA request.



Thank you,



Taylor O'Brien (she/her)
City Clerk's Office - OPRA Clerk
65 Central Avenue, 3rd Floor
Hackensack, NJ 07601
(P): 201-646-3940
(F): 201-457-1466
tobrien@hackensack.org<mailto:tobrien@hackensack.org>

communications.subject: RE: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request #24-468
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. O’Brien,

I also want to make sure you’ve considered my common law right to this video. I understand you’re denying access under OPRA, but I believe there is a strong common law right to access the video in order to monitor the police department’s use of surveillance techniques on First Amendment activities and to better understand what occurred during the protest. Any claimed privacy right is minimal because this took place in public, and blurring of faces would suffice. Can you please let me know if you’ll grant access under the common law?


Sincerely,
Matthew Petti

communications.subject: RE: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request #24-468
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. O’Brien,

I just want to follow up on my previous email. Is there any determination on whether I have a common law right to this video?

Sincerely,
Matthew Petti

communications.subject: RE: [External]RE: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request #24-468
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Petti,

We have reviewed your April 24, 2024 reply to the City's April 11, 2024 e-mail correspondence pertaining to your Open Public Records Act request (ref. #24-468).  Your reply requests that the City reconsider its prior denial of access based upon "your strong common law right to access the video in order to monitor the police department's use of surveillance techniques on First Amendment activities and to better understand what occurred during the protest."  You further asserted that the blurring of faces would suffice to protect any privacy interests.

In light of your asserted interest in accessing the responsive footage and the fact that the attendees' identities cannot be ascertained from review of the footage, the City has decided to release said footage to you pursuant to the common law right of access.  Please be advised that the City is unable to provide the responsive footage electronically.  The footage will be placed on a thumb drive and mailed to you.  Kindly send us $12.11 for the cost of the thumb drive and certified mailing; we will promptly send you the footage upon receipt of same.

Thank you for your anticipated cooperation,


Taylor O'Brien (she/her)
City Clerk's Office - OPRA Clerk

Hackensack, NJ 07601

title: Echo Summit Highway 50 landslide March 2022 (El Dorado County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Echo Summit Highway 50 landslide March 2022 (El Dorado County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records, receipts, photographs, and documentary materials referencing a landslide that fell onto highway 50 Echo summit from dates of March 3, 2022 to March 6, 2022. I am also requesting documents detailing the process of removal of said landslide including documents referencing the explosives used to clear the large boulders and any receipts of costs associated with it. 

For reference, a large landslide blocked all traffic on the highway for days, before it was blasted with explosives. A news link to this can be found here. https://www.ktvu.com/news/tumbling-boulders-block-highway-50-at-echo-summit-make-travel-treacherous.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Katherine Fulwider

title: OMB approvals and Privacy Reduction Act notices for Port of Seattle and CBP

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: OMB approvals and Privacy Reduction Act notices for Port of Seattle and CBP
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any of the following, provided to the Port of Seattle (owners of Sea-Tac airport and two cruise ship terminals) by U.S. Customs and Border Protection ("CBP") and applicable to facial images collected by biometric entry and/or exit systems (including, but not limited to, Automated Passport Control kiosks): U.S. Office of Management and Budget ("OMB") approvals, OMB approval numbers, and Paperwork Reduction Act ("PRA") notices.  I also request any communications between the Port of Seattle and CBP pertaining to such OMB approvals, OMB control numbers, or PRA notices.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Phil Mocek
